intro: Triguera acerifolia, commonly known as the mapleleaf triguera, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves that resemble those of maple trees, hence its common name. It produces small, pale pink flowers that are clustered in spherical inflorescences. Triguera acerifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique foliage and delicate floral display.
